page.title: 07Farming in the Mowsley Area
page.content: Of the dozen farms in our D-block, about half are farmed by the owners, the others by tenant farmers.Much of the land is under{permanent pasture for grazing by sheep or cattle.The predominant breeds of cattle are Herefords,& Friesians,while sheep are mainly Mule Masham or Cross Suffolk. Some farmers rotate pasture land with silage.{Crops}include oats,wheat,beans and oil-seed rape.Many of the fields have copses or coverts, presumably these find favour with the local hunt. Interesting{field names}are Bargles, Troopers Meadow,Carpenters Close,Top Close,and several are named Cricket Field.The Charity field in Laughton,is rented to local people,the income from it going to the poor of Laughton. All the local markets are used by farmers.Leicester,Melton Mowbray, Market Harborough,Kettering & Rugby.
